sentence.Network_en: Alabama may have been legally forced by the courts to kill off its segregationist policies.
sentence.Network_cn: 亚拉巴马州可能已被法院依法强令终止其种族隔离政策。

sentence.Network_en: Recent federal action undermined the segregationist position.
sentence.Network_cn: 近期的联邦行动消弱了隔离主义者的地位.

PerfectNetExp.abs: segregation 种族隔离segregationist 隔离主义者segregative 分离的
英语专业泛读教程第三册单词... ... adj. segregated 被隔离的 n. segregationist 种族隔离主义者 segregator [机] 分离器；分离者.

entry.def: A segregationist is someone who thinks people of different races should be kept apart.

example.tran: 极右派种族隔离主义者

example.ex: Alabama may have been legally forced by the courts to kill off its segregationist policies.
example.tran: 亚拉巴马州可能已被法院依法强令终止其种族隔离政策。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who believes the races should be kept apart

auth_sentence.content: Rights activists led by Martin Luther King Jr. clashed with segregationist die-hards.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rights activists led by Martin Luther King Jr. clashed with segregationist die-hards.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rights activists led by Martin Luther King Jr. clashed with segregationist die-hards.

auth_sentence.content: His advocacy discomfited segregationist southern Democrats such as John Stennis and Strom Thurmond.
auth_sentence.res_content: His advocacy discomfited segregationist southern Democrats such as John Stennis and Strom Thurmond.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His advocacy discomfited segregationist southern Democrats such as John Stennis and Strom Thurmond.

auth_sentence.content: It was an ambiguous promise that sounded like the words of a segregationist without specifically opposing segregation.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was an ambiguous promise that sounded like the words of a segregationist without specifically opposing segregation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was an ambiguous promise that sounded like the words of a segregationist without specifically opposing segregation.
